questions.question: A major drawback of OFDM is:

explanations.a: Incorrect. OFDM has relatively low out-of-band radiation due to pulse shaping.
explanations.b: Correct. OFDM signals have high PAPR, which stresses power amplifiers.
explanations.c: Incorrect. OFDM requires both time and frequency synchronization.
explanations.d: Incorrect. OFDM is specifically designed to handle multipath fading.

questions.question: Which of the following techniques is used to reduce PAPR in OFDM?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Zero forcing is an equalization technique, not for PAPR reduction.
explanations.b: Correct. Clipping and filtering are common PAPR reduction methods.
explanations.c: Incorrect. MMSE equalization targets noise, not PAPR.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Increasing cyclic prefix length does not reduce PAPR.

questions.question: Why is a cyclic prefix used instead of a simple zero-padding in OFDM?

answers.c: It preserves circular convolution structure, enabling diagonalization via FFT

explanations.a: Incorrect. CP mainly helps with ISI, not synchronization.
explanations.b: Incorrect. CP does not reduce PAPR.
explanations.c: Correct. CP maintains circular convolution so the channel appears diagonal in frequency domain.
explanations.d: Incorrect. CP slightly reduces spectral efficiency.

questions.question: The number of subcarriers in an OFDM system is typically:

answers.c: A power of 2 for efficient FFT implementation

explanations.a: Incorrect. Prime numbers are not used for FFT size.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Large number of subcarriers reduce bandwidth per subcarrier, not delay.
explanations.c: Correct. Powers of 2 optimize FFT/IFFT computational efficiency.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Modulation order and number of subcarriers are unrelated.

questions.question: OFDM achieves robustness to frequency-selective fading primarily because:

answers.a: It transmits in the time domain only
answers.b: It averages fading over multiple antennas
answers.c: Each subcarrier sees flat fading due to narrowband nature

explanations.a: Incorrect. OFDM modulates data in frequency domain as well.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Diversity techniques achieve this, not OFDM alone.
explanations.c: Correct. Narrowband subcarriers simplify fading to flat fading.
explanations.d: Incorrect. OFDM can use coherent modulation schemes.

questions.question: What does 'orthogonal' refer to in OFDM?

answers.a: The sub-carriers are all orthogonal to each other, which can mitigate inter-carrier interference (ICI)
answers.b: The basis signals used to perform QAM encoding are orthogonal

explanations.a: Correct. Orthogonality between subcarriers prevents interference between them.
explanations.b: Incorrect. QAM signals are not necessarily orthogonal.

questions.question: Which one of the following is NOT correct in the context of OFDM?

answers.a: We consider flat fading over the channel corresponding to each sub-carrier
answers.b: We consider flat fading over the entire channel
answers.c: This scheme provides efficient bandwidth usage
answers.d: This scheme can be used in a MIMO system to achieve frequency as well as spatial multiplexing

explanations.a: Correct. OFDM splits the channel into flat-fading subchannels.
explanations.b: Correct answer. Entire channel experiences frequency-selective fading, not flat fading.
explanations.c: Correct. OFDM efficiently uses bandwidth via orthogonal subcarriers.
explanations.d: Correct. OFDM combined with MIMO achieves spatial and frequency multiplexing.

questions.question: What is the length of the FIR of the channel?

explanations.a: Incorrect. N usually denotes number of subcarriers or samples.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This is not the standard FIR length.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This is related to convolution length but not FIR length alone.
explanations.d: Correct. μ typically denotes the channel impulse response length.

questions.question: What is the rate of this scheme (in no. of QAM symbols per sampling time)?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Rate does not increase with CP length.
explanations.b: Incorrect. μ is CP length, not rate.
explanations.c: Correct. The effective rate corresponds to number of subcarriers N.

questions.question: Which of the following is correct?

answers.a: Channel state information (CSI) at the transmitter is necessary for this scheme to be effective
answers.b: Choosing a larger number of sub-carriers will lead to more accurate (less errors) communication
answers.c: If too many sub-carriers are used, it might lead to inter-carrier interference (ICI)
answers.d: Cyclic prefix is mandatory even if this scheme is implemented in continuous time

explanations.a: Incorrect. CSI at the transmitter is not mandatory for OFDM.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Increasing subcarriers can reduce bandwidth per subcarrier but not always reduce errors.
explanations.c: Correct. Excessive subcarriers may violate orthogonality and increase ICI.
explanations.d: Incorrect. CP is only necessary in discrete-time implementations with multipath.
